required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of IBI188 in Combination With AZA in Subjects With Newly Diagnosed MDS
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1b Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of IBI188 in Combination With Azacitidine in Subjects With Newly Diagnosed Higher Risk Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, phase 1b study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and preliminary efficacy of IBI188 in combination with Azacitidine in newly diagnosed higher risk MDS patients.

clinical_study.why_stopped: pause for further assessment and study adjustment

primary_outcome.description: Adverse events according to national Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) Version 5.0 or customized AE severity grading as defined in the protocol

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of IBI188 in combination with AZA
primary_outcome.description: International Working Group (IWG) 2006 criteria will be used to evaluate efficacy of IBI188 in combination with AZA for response criteria for MDS

arm_group.description: Participants will receive IBI188 in combination with azacitidine

intervention.description: IBI188: 100 mg/mL, intravenous infusion once a week
Azacitidine (VIDAZA) for Injection:100 mg per vial, subcutaneous injection will be administered for 7 days in each 28 day cycle

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
1. Newly diagnosed MDS subjects with higher risk.
2. Age ≥ 18 years old.
3. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group score of 0-2.
4. Adequate organ function.
5. Subjects should take effective contraceptive measures.
6. Must sign the Informed Consent Form (ICF), and be able to follow all study procedures.
Main Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject who has transformed from MDS to AML.
2. MDS subjects with lower risk.
3. Subjects who have received chemotherapy.
4. History of chronic hemolytic anemia
5. Prior exposure to any anti-CD47 or anti-SIRPα agents.
6. Subjects participating in another interventional clinical study.

facility.name: American Oncology Partners of Maryland, PA
New Jersey Center for Cancer Research
